remarks: In an Archimedean group, given two positive elements, there exists a "divisor" ` n ` .  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 30-Jan-2018.)
statement:
archiexdiv.b $e |- B = ( Base ` W ) $.
archiexdiv.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
archiexdiv.i $e |- .< = ( lt ` W ) $.
archiexdiv.x $e |- .x. = ( .g ` W ) $.
archiexdiv $p |- ( ( ( W e. oGrp /\ W e. Archi ) /\ ( X e. B /\ Y e. B ) /\ .0. .< X ) -> E. n e. NN Y .< ( n .x. X ) ) $.
$d .0. n $.
$d .< n $.
$d .x. n $.
$d B n $.
$d W n $.
$d X n $.
$d Y n $.
